Comments: Any unprefixed field searches the combination of all fields together. I.e. a search for “cell AND name:myImage” gets translated to “combined_fields:cell AND name:myImage”.
Each string, timestamp, or Details field of the entity also gets its own Field entry, like the _name_ field above
Login name of the owner of the object
First name of the owner of the object
Last name of the owner of the object
Group name of the owning group of the object
Id of the Event of this objects creation
When that Event took place
Id of the Event of this objects last modification
When that Event took place
Permissions in the form _rwrwrw_ or _rw_-_
Contents from a TagAnnotation.
Contents from any annotations, including TagAnnotations and any TextAnnotation on another TextAnnotation (a.k.a. a _description_

Field: annotation.ns,Namespace (if present) for any annotations on an object

Comments: Short type name, e.g. TextAnnotation or FileAnnotation for any annotations on an object
For FileAnnotations and objects they are attached to, the name of the OriginalFile

Field: file.format,"For FileAnnotations and objects they are attached to, the format of the OriginalFile"

Comments: For FileAnnotations and objects they are attached to, the path of the OriginalFile
For FileAnnotations and objects they are attached to, the sha1 of the OriginalFile
For FileAnnotations and objects they are attached to as well as the ``OriginalFile`` itself, the file contents themselves if their Format is configured with the File parsers.
The default field prefix.

Field: _hibernate_class,"Used by Hibernate Search to record the entity type. The class value, e.g. ome.model.core.Image is also entered in combined_fields. Unimportant for the casual users"

Comments: The primary key of the entity. Unimportant for the casual user
